annotation.description: Add `orchestrator:terraform` as annotation to all objects. This can also be set as the ACI_ANNOTATION environment variable. Defaults to `true`.

cert_name.description: Certificate name for the User in Cisco ACI. This can also be set as the ACI_CERT_NAME environment variable.

insecure.description: Allow insecure HTTPS client. This can also be set as the ACI_INSECURE environment variable. Defaults to `true`.

mock.description: Only mock API calls. This is mainly for troubleshooting/debugging purposes. This can also be set as the ACI_MOCK environment variable. Defaults to `false`.

password.description: Password for the APIC Account. This can also be set as the ACI_PASSWORD environment variable.

private_key.description: Private key path for signature calculation. This can also be set as the ACI_PRIVATE_KEY environment variable.

proxy_url.description: Proxy Server URL with port number. This can also be set as the ACI_PROXY_URL environment variable.

retries.description: Number of retries for REST API calls. This can also be set as the ACI_RETRIES environment variable. Defaults to `3`.

url.description: URL of the Cisco ACI web interface. This can also be set as the ACI_URL environment variable.

username.description: Username for the APIC Account. This can also be set as the ACI_USERNAME environment variable.

class_name.description: Which class object is being created. (Make sure there is no colon in the classname)

content.description: Map of key-value pairs those needed to be passed to the Model object as parameters. Make sure the key name matches the name with the object parameter in ACI.

dn.description: Distinguished name of object being managed including its relative name, e.g. uni/tn-EXAMPLE_TENANT.

id.description: The distinguished name of the object.

content.description: Map of key-value pairs which represents the attributes for the child object.

rn.description: The relative name of the child object.

block.description: Manages ACI Model Objects via REST API calls. This resource can only manage a single API object and its direct children. It is able to read the state and therefore reconcile configuration drift.

child.description: Set of children of object being retrieved.

class_name.description: Class name of object being retrieved.

content.description: Map of key-value pairs which represents the attributes of object being retrieved.

dn.description: Distinguished name of object to be retrieved, e.g. uni/tn-EXAMPLE_TENANT.

id.description: The distinguished name of the object.

block.description: This data source can read one ACI object and its children.
